Exaggerate: The claim that Zika "will be everywhere in the United States" is an exaggeration, as it is unlikely to be present in all areas of the country.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to suggest that Zika will be widespread throughout the United States.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Zika will spread extensively in the United States without providing sufficient evidence or data to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the spread of Zika, such as travel-related cases or localized outbreaks, which contradict the claim that it will be everywhere in the United States.
